thread.title: Jim Youngbloods New Book A Boy From Alabama is a Touching and Wistful Remembrance of a Happy Childhood Spent Living and Exploring in Alabama in the 1930s.

author: cbs8
title: Jim Youngbloods New Book A Boy From Alabama is a Touching and Wistful Remembrance of a Happy Childhood Spent Living and Exploring in Alabama in the 1930s.
text:
Recent release “A Boy From Alabama” from Page Publishing author Jim Youngblood is a proud and joyful tale from a man who remembers his childhood in brilliant and vivid detail.
(PRWEB) October 23, 2015
Jim Youngblood, an 86 year old world traveler, has completed his new book “A Boy From Alabama”: a delightful retrospect of youth well spent deep in the creeks and rivers of 1930’s Alabama.
Mr. Youngblood says, “I am proud of my childhood in Alabama and visit my area of upbringing whenever possible.”
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Jim Youngblood’s poignant and colorful recollections transport the reader to rural Alabama. Mr. Youngblood’s gift to distinctly remember his early childhood make for an engaging and captivating story.
Join Jim to explore the creeks and rivers that facilitated his passion to explore nature and all it offered to him, back when people were honest, hardworking, and willing to help others.
Readers who wish to experience this charming work can purchase “A Boy From Alabama” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
About Page Publishing
Page Publishing is a traditional New York based full-service publishing house that handles all of the intricacies involved in publishing its authors’ books, including distribution in the world’s largest retail outlets and royalty generation. Page Publishing knows that authors need to be free to create - not bogged down with complicated business issues like eBook conversion, establishing wholesale accounts, insurance, shipping, taxes and the like. Its roster of authors can leave behind these tedious, complex and time consuming issues, and focus on their passion: writing and creating. Learn more at http://www.pagepublishing.com .
